headline.main: For Some Women, Losing Pounds Could Add Up to a Hip Fracture

docs.lead_paragraph: IT is taken as an article of faith that a leaner body is a healthier body. But for some people, losing weight appears to be a health hazard. A study by the National Institute on Aging has found that women who lose a lot of weight beginning at the age of 50 significantly increase their risk of hip fractures. The increase is so pronounced that the researchers are recommending that doctors take the weight history of postmenopausal women into account when assessing their hip-fracture risks and prescribing preventive measures.
